TECHNICAL_SECTION.FORM_LG_LIST: DA DE EN ES FI FR EL IT NL PT SV CS ET HU LT LV MT PL SK SL GA BG RO HR

CODIF_DATA.TD_DOCUMENT_TYPE: Prior information notice without call for competition
CODIF_DATA.RP_REGULATION: European Investment Bank, European Investment Fund, European Bank for Reconstruction and Development
CODIF_DATA.HEADING: BR404

ML_TI_DOC.TI_TEXT: BERD - Projet relatif à l'approvisionnement en eau à Sarajevo
EBOR - Projekt dotyczący sieci wodociągowej w Sarajewie
EBOR - Oskrba z vodo v Sarajevu
BERD - Proiect privind apa în Sarajevo

CONTENTS.P: Procurement ref: 9077-GPN-48252
Project name: Sarajevo Water
Country: Bosnia and Herzegovina
Business sector: Municipal and environmental infrastructure
Project number: 48252
Funding source: EBRD
Contract type: Project goods, works and services
Notice type: General Procurement Notices
Issue date: 27.4.2018
Closing date: 27.4.2019
This notice is an update to the GPN originally published on the EBRD's web-site on 20.3.2017.

The Sarajevo Canton and KJKP “Vodovod i kanalizacije” DOO Sarajevo intend using the proceeds of a loan from the European bank for reconstruction and development (“the Bank”) for a project to reduce the water losses and eliminate cuts in water supply in Sarajevo. The proposed project, which has a total estimated cost of 30 000 000 EUR, will require the procurement of the following goods, works and services:
— reconstruction of pumping stations including equipment for power supply, chlorination and control,
— reconstruction of bulk water pipelines (both pressure and gravitational),
— replacement of obsolete water mains in selected parts of the distribution network,
— installation of meters (individual, bulk water flow meters, telemetry etc.),
— supervision services.
Tendering for the above contracts is expected to begin in the second quarter of 2018.

Contracts to be financed with the proceeds of a loan from the Bank will be subject to the Bank's procurement policies and rules, and will be open to firms from any country. The proceeds of the Bank's loan will not be used for the purpose of any payment to persons or entities, of for any import of goods, if such payment or import is prohibited by a decision of the United Nations security council taken under Chapter VII of the Charter of the United Nations or under a law of official regulation of the Purchaser's country.

Tendering for this project will be conducted by e-procurement using the EBRD Client E-Procurement Portal (ECEPP). Interested suppliers, contractors and consultants should register on ECEPP in order to receive notifications via this link: https://ecepp.ebrd.com/delta/viewNotice.html?displayNoticeId=5856447
Interested suppliers, contractors and consultants should contact:

ADDRESS_NOT_STRUCT.BLK_BTX: Esnef Puriš, B.Sc. Mechanical, Quality Manager

This notice is an update to the GPN originally published on the EBRD's web-site on 20.3.2017.

The Sarajevo Canton and KJKP “Vodovod i kanalizacije” DOO Sarajevo intend using the proceeds of a loan from the European bank for reconstruction and development (“the Bank”) for a project to reduce the water losses and eliminate cuts in water supply in Sarajevo. The proposed project, which has a total estimated cost of 30 000 000 EUR, will require the procurement of the following goods, works and services:
— reconstruction of pumping stations including equipment for power supply, chlorination and control,
— reconstruction of bulk water pipelines (both pressure and gravitational),
— replacement of obsolete water mains in selected parts of the distribution network,
— installation of meters (individual, bulk water flow meters, telemetry etc.),
— supervision services.
Tendering for the above contracts is expected to begin in the second quarter of 2018.

Contracts to be financed with the proceeds of a loan from the Bank will be subject to the Bank's procurement policies and rules, and will be open to firms from any country. The proceeds of the Bank's loan will not be used for the purpose of any payment to persons or entities, of for any import of goods, if such payment or import is prohibited by a decision of the United Nations security council taken under Chapter VII of the Charter of the United Nations or under a law of official regulation of the Purchaser's country.

Tendering for this project will be conducted by e-procurement using the EBRD Client E-Procurement Portal (ECEPP). Interested suppliers, contractors and consultants should register on ECEPP in order to receive notifications via this link: https://ecepp.ebrd.com/delta/viewNotice.html?displayNoticeId=5856447
Interested suppliers, contractors and consultants should contact:

ADDRESS_NOT_STRUCT.BLK_BTX: Esnef Puriš, B.Sc. Mechanical, Quality Manager
